alert.note: Alert for Plumas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 5:24PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF THE DIXIE AND SHEEP FIRE BURN SCARS... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast California, including the following counties, Lassen and Plumas. * WHEN...Until 730 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 520 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen, mainly in quick bursts lasting 15 minutes or less. - The heavy rainfall may produce isolated debris flows over the Dixie and Sheep fire burn scars in Plumas County and far southern Lassen County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beckwourth, Susanville, Antelope Lake, Genesee, Grizzly Campground, Lake Davis, Mohawk Vista, Delleker, Long Point Campground, Boulder Creek Campground, Lone Rock Campground, Lightning Tree Campground, Grasshopper Flat Campground and Cromberg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
